results.title: The Greatest run on earth
results.creator_credit: Sam Pillsbury, Pillsbury Films and Television New Zealand
results.brief_description: Why does an entire city suddenly go crazy on running? In the land where jogging was ‘invented’ by Arthur Lydiard twenty years ago, a film crew looked closely at how the city of Auckland, population a mere 500,000 is convulsed by preparations for this bizarre annual event, ‘the greatest run on earth’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Pillsbury, Pillsbury Films and Television New Zealand

results.title: The Greatest game on earth
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Roland Beckett, Australian National Football Council and Melbourne Repertory Film Unit
results.brief_description: Ricky, who has recently arrived in Australia, sees his first game of Australian Rules Football when he follows the boys of his neighbourhood to the Melbourne Cricket Ground where Geelong is playing Collingwood. At first the atmosphere is strange and new, but the boy soon becomes a part of the enthusiastic crowd excited by the fast field play, high punt kicks, snap shots for goal and clever manoeuvres which comprise Australia’s national sport.

results.title: The Greatest gamble
results.brief_description: Christopher Brasher assesses the gambles taken in supporting new inventions and introduces some of the men involved. Includes the trials of the Dr Barnes Wallis swing wing aircraft, and Professor F. C. Williams of Manchester University relives the moment when he saw the way of solving the problems of electronic memory. Other contributors includes Christopher Cockerell who discusses hovercraft, Geoffrey Stockdale on the take-apart ship and Donald Firth on the revolution in cars and machine tools.

results.title: The Greater community animal
results.brief_description: An animated film which examines why the individual has to have his idiosyncrasies and his potentialities processed out of existence in order to be made acceptable to society. Considers individualism, conformism and the compromises which have to be made. American Film Festival Blue Ribbon.

results.title: The Great Train Robbery
results.brief_description: Edwin Stanton Porter (April 21, 1870 – April 30, 1941) was an American film pioneer, most famous as a producer, director, studio manager and cinematographer with the Edison Manufacturing Company and the Famous Players Film Company. Of over 250 films created by Porter, his most important include Jack and the Beanstalk (1902), Life of an American Fireman (1903), The Great Train Robbery (1903), The Kleptomaniac (1905), Life of a Cowboy (1906), Rescued from an Eagle’s Nest (1908), and The Prisoner of Zenda (1913) .
results.description: Edwin Stanton Porter (April 21, 1870 – April 30, 1941) was an American film pioneer, most famous as a producer, director, studio manager and cinematographer with the Edison Manufacturing Company and the Famous Players Film Company. results.title: The Great Impressionists
results.creator_credit: Steve Isaac, Australian National Gallery and Capital 7 Canberra
results.brief_description: The Great Impressionists exhibition at the Australian National Gallery in 1984 featured works of leading Impressionists such as Manet, Degas, Renoir, Monet, Cezanne, Van Gogh, Pissaro, Gauguin and Seurat. The script, explaining the priceless collection on loan from the Courtauld Institute in London, was written by the Gallery’s Senior Curator of Education, Terence Measham with the express desire to delight and entertain as well as inform.

results.title: The Great health robbery
results.brief_description: Infant mortality caused by misuse of powdered milk is growing in many Third World countries, despite widespread awareness of the dangers. Outlines the problems in Yemen, and criticises the marketing of powdered milk, which many mothers use in order to appear progressive and Western.

results.title: The Great Gatsby [Ed. version]
results.creator_credit: Jack Clayton, David Merrick and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Edited version of feature film adaption of F. Scott Fitzgerald’s novel starring Robert Redford and Mia Farrow. Credits include screenplay by Francis Ford Coppola and music by Nelson Riddle.

results.title: The Great game
results.brief_description: Association football in Britain, how it is played, the crowds it draws, and what it means to the players and spectators. The game is traced in its various forms from school soccer to first class professional play. Includes scenes photographed at the 1944 Cup Final at which Bolton defeated Chelsea.

results.title: The Great energy waste
results.brief_description: An evil genius had created an unnatural impulse in Canadians to overcome energy. A scientist and his sardonic dog work to foil his plans.
